Idle.texture: Transparent Button With White Blue Border_Idle.png

Pressed.texture: Transparent Button With White Blue Border_Pressed.png

objects.name: Blue_Raptor_Dialogue
objects.string: Greetings my raptor sibling. It appears our confinement has come to an end. These walls harm us no more. We can now break free! Move and destroy these walls.

objects.name: WASD_Arrow
objects.string: Use WASD or Arrow keys to walk

objects.name: SPACE
objects.string: Many things act as platforms to jump on. Press Space to jump.

objects.name: NPCs
objects.string: Friendly NPCs can be interacted with by clicking on them.

objects.name: Gray_Raptor_Dialogue
objects.string: (Light Hissing)

objects.name: Score
objects.string: Score: 0

objects.name: Attacks
objects.string: Objects and enemies can be destroyed and defeated by attacking them. Use your chomp ability while running (hold left mouse) or use your slash ability while standing still (hold right mouse).

objects.name: Ramming_Electrical_Fences
objects.string:
This fence has already been weakened by your red sister. Ram into it to destroy it. 

If you take too much damage you will die. Stand still to recover lost health.

objects.name: Compy2
objects.string: There are Compies nearby! They are incredibly fast. Don't panic, they will mind their own business as long as you are still moving. If you stand still, they will attack. You can easily attack them back and get rid of them.

objects.name: Brown_Raptor_Dialogue
objects.string: We are free! We must go and protect our colony. Stop those strange creatures who trapped us.

objects.name: Compy_Nest_Explaination
objects.string: This is a compy nest. It will release compies occasionally. Destroy it to stop more from coming.

objects.name: Dilo_Explaination
objects.string: There are dilophosaurus' up ahead. They will spit at you if you get too close. Make sure to get rid of them quickly.

objects.name: Boss
objects.string: I saw a tall thing over there! Attack it!

objects.name: Red_Raptor_Dialogue
objects.string: Go ahead, I broke the walls.

objects.name: Defeat_the_boss
objects.string: Defeat the Tall Dinosaur

objects.name: Escape
objects.string: Escape

objects.name: Move
objects.string: Explore and Secure The Park

objects.name: Finish_The_Boss
objects.string: GO BACK AND DEFEAT THAT TALL THING!!!

objects.name: Lore
objects.string:
You escaped your containment and have found yourself in the park itself. Now you must continue onward, to protect. 
For revenge.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectSpawner
description: Spawn objects periodically and control their number.
It can be used to create:

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Spawn (create) objects periodically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ObjectSpawner

eventsFunctions.description: Spawn (create) objects periodically. This action must be run every frame to work. When the max quantity is reached and an instance is deleted, the spawner waits the duration of the spawn period before creating another instance. Spawned objects are automatically linked to the spawner.
eventsFunctions.name: SpawnObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Periodically spawn (create) a _PARAM2_ located at spawner _PARAM0_

events.comment: Check if max number of instances per spawner has been reached. Always spawn objects if quantity is set to "0"
Prevent objects from being spawned immediately after deleting an object while at max quantity alive
Check if max number of instances per spawner has been reached
Reset spawn detection
Spawn an object when conditions are met. Spawned objects are linked to the spawner that made them

eventsFunctions.description: Change the offset X relative to the center of spawner (in pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: SetOffsetX
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the offset X of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ pixels

eventsFunctions.description: Change the offset Y relative to the center of spawner (in pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: SetOffsetY
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the offset Y of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ pixels

eventsFunctions.description: Change the spawn period (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: SetSpawnPeriod
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the spawn period of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Return the offset X relative to the center of spawner (in pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: OffsetX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the offset Y relative to the center of spawner (in pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctions.description: Return the spawn period (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: SpawnPeriod

eventsFunctions.description: Restart the cooldown of a spawner.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetSpawnTimer

eventsFunctions.description: Return the remaining time before the next spawn (in seconds). Useful for triggering visual and sound effects.
eventsFunctions.name: TimeBeforeSpawn

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object has just been created by this spawner. Useful for triggering visual and sound effects.
eventsFunctions.name: ObjectWasJustSpawned

eventsFunctions.description: the max objects in the scene (per spawner) of the object. Limits the number of objects in the scene that were created by this spawner. Set this to 0 for no limit.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Max objects in the scene (per spawner)
eventsFunctions.name: MaxQuantity
eventsFunctions.sentence: the max objects in the scene (per spawner)

eventsFunctions.description: Check if spawner has unlimited capacity.
eventsFunctions.name: UnlimitedObjectCapacity

eventsFunctions.description: Change unlimited capacity of spawner.
eventsFunctions.name: SetUnlimitedObjectCapacity

eventsFunctions.description: the number of objects that can be created by this spawner. This is reduced everytime an objects is spawned.
eventsFunctions.name: SpawnerCapacity

propertyDescriptors.label: Offset X (relative to position of spawner)
propertyDescriptors.name: OffsetX

propertyDescriptors.label: Offset Y (relative to position of spawner)
propertyDescriptors.name: OffsetY

propertyDescriptors.label: Max objects in the scene (per spawner)
propertyDescriptors.description: Limits the number of objects in the scene that were created by this spawner. Set this to 0 for no limit.
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxQuantity

propertyDescriptors.label: Spawner capacity
propertyDescriptors.description: Number of objects that can be created by this spawner. This is reduced everytime an objects is spawned.
propertyDescriptors.name: SpawnerCapacity

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets.
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Increase heat (if needed)
Check if this caused overheat
Detect when reload is completed
Only reload the amount of ammo available

events.name: Reduce heat level (based on cooling rate)

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward an object.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward _PARAM5_ with speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.name: Calculate the trajectory angle and use the "Fire bullets" action

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward a position.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward position _PARAM5_;_PARAM6_ with speed _PARAM7_ px/s

events.name: Calculate the trajectory angle and use the "Fire bullets" action

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets in the direction of a given angle.
eventsFunctions.name: Fire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.comment: Move temp variable to the next angle a bullet will be sent

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a single bullet. This is only meant to be used inside the "Fire bullet" action.
eventsFunctions.name: FireSingleBullet
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire a single bullet _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, with angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.comment: Create bullet
Move bullet (apply angle and bullet speed variances)
Add identifier variables (to enable advanced picking by users)
Rotate newly created bullet, if needed
Update statistics

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Reload ammo.
eventsFunctions.name: ReloadAmmo

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object has just fired something.
eventsFunctions.name: HasJustFired

eventsFunctions.description: Check if bullet rotates to match trajectory.
eventsFunctions.name: BulletRotationEnabled

eventsFunctions.description: the firing arc (in degrees) where bullets are shot. Bullets are evenly spaced out inside the firing arc.
eventsFunctions.name: FiringArc

eventsFunctions.description: Change the firing arc (in degrees) where bullets will be shot. Bullets will be evenly spaced out inside the firing arc.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFiringArc
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set firing arc of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ degrees

eventsFunctions.description: the angle variance (in degrees) applied to each bullet.
eventsFunctions.name: AngleVariance

eventsFunctions.description: Change the angle variance (in degrees) applied to each bullet.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAngleVariance
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set angle variance of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ degrees

eventsFunctions.description: the bullet speed variance (pixels per second) applied to each bullet.
eventsFunctions.name: BulletSpeedVariance

eventsFunctions.description: Change the speed variance (pixels per second) applied to each bullet.
eventsFunctions.name: SetBulletSpeedVariance
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set bullet speed variance of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ pixels per second

eventsFunctions.description: the number of bullets shot every time the "fire bullet" action is used.
eventsFunctions.name: BulletQuantity
eventsFunctions.sentence: the number of bullets per shot

eventsFunctions.description: Change the number of bullets shot every time the "fire bullet" action is used.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Set number of bullets per shot (deprecated)
eventsFunctions.name: SetBulletQuantity
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set number of bullets per shot of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the layer that bullets are created on.
eventsFunctions.name: SetBulletLayer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the layer used to create bullets fired by _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Enable bullet rotation.
eventsFunctions.name: SetRotateBullet

eventsFunctions.description: Enable unlimited ammo.
eventsFunctions.name: SetUnlimitedAmmo

eventsFunctions.description: the firing cooldown (in seconds) also known as rate of fire.
eventsFunctions.name: Cooldown

eventsFunctions.description: Change the firing cooldown, which changes the rate of fire.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCooldown
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the fire rate of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: the reload duration (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: ReloadDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Change the duration to reload ammo.
eventsFunctions.name: SetReloadDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the reload duration of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: the overheat duration (in seconds). When an object is overheated, it can't fire for this duration.
eventsFunctions.name: OverheatDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Change the duration after becoming overheated.
eventsFunctions.name: SetOverheatDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the overheat duration of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: the ammo quantity.
eventsFunctions.name: AmmoQuantity

eventsFunctions.description: Change the quantity of ammo.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAmmoQuantity
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the ammo quantity of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: the heat increase per shot.
eventsFunctions.name: HeatIncreasePerShot

eventsFunctions.description: Change the heat increase per shot.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHeatPerShot
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the heat increase of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ per shot

eventsFunctions.description: the max ammo.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxAmmo

eventsFunctions.description: Change the max ammo.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxAmmo
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the max ammo of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Reset total shots fired.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetTotalShotsFired

eventsFunctions.description: Reset total bullets created.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetTotalBulletsCreated

eventsFunctions.description: Reset total reloads completed.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetTotalReloadsCompleted

eventsFunctions.description: the number of shots per reload.
eventsFunctions.name: ShotsPerReload

eventsFunctions.description: Change the number of shots per reload.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShotsPerReload
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the shots per reload of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) automatic reloading.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAutomaticReload

eventsFunctions.description: the linear cooling rate (per second).
eventsFunctions.name: LinearCoolingRate

eventsFunctions.description: Change the linear rate of cooling.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLinearCoolingRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the linear cooling rate of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ per second

eventsFunctions.description: the exponential cooling rate, per second.
eventsFunctions.name: ExponentialCoolingRate

eventsFunctions.description: Change the exponential rate of cooling.
eventsFunctions.name: SetExponentialCoolingRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the exponential cooling rate of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Increase ammo quantity.
eventsFunctions.name: IncreaseAmmo

events.comment: If Max Ammo is set, do not exceed the value

eventsFunctions.description: Layer that bullets are created on.
eventsFunctions.name: BulletLayer

eventsFunctions.description: the heat level (range: 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: HeatLevel

eventsFunctions.description: Total shots fired (multi-bullet shots are considered one shot).
eventsFunctions.name: TotalShotsFired

eventsFunctions.description: Total bullets created.
eventsFunctions.name: TotalBulletsCreated

eventsFunctions.description: Reloads completed.
eventsFunctions.name: TotalReloadsCompleted

eventsFunctions.description: the remaining shots before the next reload is required.
eventsFunctions.name: ShotsBeforeNextReload
eventsFunctions.sentence: the remaining shots (before the next reload)

eventsFunctions.description: the remaining duration before the cooldown will permit a bullet to be fired, in seconds.
eventsFunctions.name: CooldownTimeLeft
eventsFunctions.sentence: the remaining duration before the cooldown end

eventsFunctions.description: the remaining duration before the overheat penalty ends, in seconds.
eventsFunctions.name: OverheatTimeLeft
eventsFunctions.sentence: the remaining duration before the overheat end

eventsFunctions.description: Check if object is currently performing an ammo reload.
eventsFunctions.name: IsReloadInProgress

eventsFunctions.description: Check if object is ready to shoot.
eventsFunctions.name: IsReadyToShoot

eventsFunctions.description: Check if automatic reloading is enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: IsAutomaticReloadingEnabled

eventsFunctions.name: IsUnlimitedAmmo

eventsFunctions.description: Check if object has no ammo available.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOutOfAmmo

eventsFunctions.name: IsReloadNeeded

events.comment: Shots per reload must not be "0"

eventsFunctions.description: Check if object is overheated.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOverheated

eventsFunctions.description: Check if firing cooldown is active.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFiringCooldownActive

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangleMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern with easing functions from the Tween extension.
- Moving along the border of another object (inside, center, outside)
The platformer example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer)).
This game shows how to make objects move around the border of another object ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://moving-saw-platformer)).
This example can be used to test different settings ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://rectangular-movement)).

eventsFunctions.description: Distance from an object to the closest edge of a second object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Distance from an object to the closest edge of a second object
eventsFunctions.name: DistanceToClosestEdge
eventsFunctions.sentence: Distance from _PARAM1_ to the closest edge of _PARAM2_

events.comment: If point is inside rectangle, just use min distance

parameters:
min(
min(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY() - CenterObject.BoundingBoxTop(), 
CenterObject.BoundingBoxBottom() - MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY()),
min(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX() - CenterObject.BoundingBoxLeft(), 
CenterObject.BoundingBoxRight() - MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX())
)

events.comment: If point is outside rectangle, find distance to clamped position on rectangle

parameters:
DistanceBetweenPositions(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX(),
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY(),
clamp(MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxLeft(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxRight()),
clamp(MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxTop(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxBottom())
)

eventsFunctions.description: Update rectangular movement to follow the border of an object. Run once, or every time the center object moves.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Update rectangular movement to follow the border of an object
eventsFunctions.name: MoveAlongBorderOfObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Update rectangular movement of _PARAM1_ to follow the border of _PARAM3_. Position on border: _PARAM4_

events.name: Create object link (if one has not been created)
Set a valid initial value by picking any Center object
Update value if distance is lower than existing minimum
Link objects that have the closest distance

events.comment: Link the MovingObject that has the shortest distance (and don't create more links even if another object has the same distance)

events.name: Update rectangular movement to follow the border of object

eventsFunctions.description: Move to the nearest corner of the center object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Move to the nearest corner of the center object
eventsFunctions.name: MoveToNearestCorner
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM1_ to the nearest corner of _PARAM3_

events.name: Create a link to the closest object

events.comment: Distance to TopLeft (don't use a condition on the first check so the variable starts with a valid corner)
Distance to TopRight
Distance to BottomLeft
Distance to BottomRight

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RectangleMovement

events.comment: Set the initial state according to the configuration.
Update the rectangle when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Move the object on the rectangular path.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Step on the path.

eventsFunctions.description: Teleport the object to a corner of the movement rectangle.
eventsFunctions.name: TeleportToCorner
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the position of _PARAM0_ at the _PARAM2_ of the rectangle loop

eventsFunctions.description: Return the time the object takes to go through the whole rectangle (in seconds).

eventsFunctions.name: Height

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time the object takes to go through a vertical edge (in seconds).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinkTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Conditions to use Linked Objects as a graph and a path finding movement behavior.
description: * "Can reach through links" conditions, useful to check if an object is linked to another through one or more other linked objects.
* a path finding movement behavior that uses objects links (instead of obstacles for the other behavior)
For instance, it can be helpful for grid-based games like:
* Point and click (bypass obstacles with a predetermined polygonal chain)

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for text ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate text to simulate it being written one character at at time (a "typewriter" effect).
description: Animate text to simulate it being written one character at at time (a "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.
- Add the behavior to a Text object (BBText, Bitmap Text object) and choose the interval between characters.
- Change the typing speed with the "Change interval" action.
- Pause the typing and resume it at any time.
- Use the "Skip to end of text" action to give users a way to skip text they don't want to read
- If the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
- Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
- Use a condition to check if a new text character was added. This is useful to trigger audio effects.
- Use the "CurrentCharacter" expression to know when a specific character was displayed.
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SecretCode
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allows to input a secret code for cheats and easter eggs.
description: Allows to input a secret code for cheats and easter eggs.
There are two behaviors in this extension: `SecretCode` and `ManualSecretCode`.
To use `SecretCode`, simply attach the behavior to any object in a scene and set the desired code. Use the `Code entered` condition in the editor to trigger your desired effects with events.

To use `ManualSecretCode`, first attach the behavior to any object in a scene. To enter a key, use the `Input key` action, and use the `Code entered` condition in the editor to trigger your desired effects with events.

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the text of the button label.
eventsFunctions.name: SetLabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label text.

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterWithPaddingY

eventsFunctions.description: Center the label according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterLabel

eventsFunctions.description: De/activate interactions with the button.
eventsFunctions.name: Activate

eventsFunctions.description: Check if interactions are activated on the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsActivated

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BehaviorRemapper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Quickly remap Behavior controls to different keys.
description: Make sure to disable default controls unless you want two keys to do the same action.
Actions have two versions. `custom` allow the movement keys to be changed to what ever you would like. `presets` provide a common key-bindings that can be selected from a list.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows for the controls of a Top-Down behavior to be re-mapped via a single action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RemapForTopdown

eventsFunctions.description: Remaps Top-Down behavior controls to a custom control scheme.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Remap Top-Down controls to a custom scheme
eventsFunctions.name: SetCustom
eventsFunctions.sentence: Remap controls of _PARAM0_: Up: _PARAM2_, Left: _PARAM3_, Down: _PARAM4_, Right: _PARAM5_

eventsFunctions.description: Remaps Top-Down behavior controls to a preset control scheme.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Remap Top-Down controls to a preset
eventsFunctions.name: SetPreset

events.comment: QWERTY bindings
AZERTY bindings
Numpad bindings
QWERTY player 2 bindings
